text: Ramat Gan (; ) is a city in the Tel Aviv District of Israel, located east of Tel Aviv. It is home to one of the world's major diamond exchanges, and many high-tech industries. The current mayor of the city is Carmel Shama. Ramat Gan was established in 1921 as a moshava, a communal farming settlement, and in 2015 it had a population of 152,596. ==References== ==Other websites== * Ramat-Gan municipal website Category:Cities in Israel Category:Tel Aviv District
title: Ramat Gan
